result.execSummary:
The defendant Journie L. Beckwith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge

Defendant agrees to Wage Assignment for balance

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Journie L. Beckwith

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Journie L. Beckwith in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16TR2642 tracking:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant will do a wage assignment.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 5 days in the Marquette County Jail
Credit = 4 days
Time Served
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on April 1, 2018

17TR2642 tracking
Return date on February 8, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

Return date on February 15, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Journie L. Beckwith in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16TR2642 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that the defendant waived her right to an Attorney and a pre-trial was set.  However, the defendant could not make the original date and asked to reset; which was reset and she failed to appear.  Atty Hendee states that an offer has not been able to be provided.
Defendant states that she would like to get PD appointment.  

BY THE COURT:  Reset to give the defendant time to get an Attorney.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for February 15, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on December 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Return date on January 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Journie L. Beckwith in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:

Court questions the defendant.   Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.    Court finds waiver of Attorney made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and Pre-Trial  Return date scheduled for January 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
